HYDRO.TITLE: Waterproofing Installation
HYDRO.INTRO_TEXT: One of the most important parts of construction is waterproofing, which protects buildings from moisture and water damage. Proper waterproofing is crucial for durability and comfort.
HYDRO.DETAIL_TEXT: Waterproofing is one of the most critical aspects of construction, protecting structures from water and damp. This process involves various techniques and materials to create a barrier that prevents water intrusion.

WHY_NEEDED_LIST.ITEM1: Structural protection: Water can damage concrete, wood, and metal structures, reducing their durability and compromising the integrity of the building.
WHY_NEEDED_LIST.ITEM2: Health protection: Damp promotes the growth of mold and fungi, which are harmful to human health and can cause allergic and respiratory issues.
WHY_NEEDED_LIST.ITEM3: Cost savings: Initial waterproofing costs are far less than repairing water-related damage.

TYPES_LIST.ITEM1: Flexible waterproofing: Uses membranes such as bituminous, EPDM, and PVC, which are elastic and do not crack during movement.
TYPES_LIST.ITEM2: Rigid waterproofing: Includes cement-based mixtures applied directly to surfaces to form a hard, waterproof layer.
TYPES_LIST.ITEM3: Injection waterproofing: Used to repair existing cracks or leaks by injecting fluid that reacts with water to form a gel or foam.

HYDRO.CONTACT_NOTE: Contact us for more information. Our specialists are ready to consult and help you choose the best solutions for your project.
HYDRO.RECOMMEND_NOTE: It is always recommended to hire qualified professionals to ensure high-quality and long-lasting waterproofing work.

FLOORING.DESC1: Self-leveling floor installation is one of the most popular methods in modern construction and renovation for achieving a perfectly smooth and level surface, which is essential for laying various types of floor coverings (laminate, parquet, tile, linoleum, vinyl flooring). This technology ensures fast and efficient results, saving time and money in the long run.
FLOORING.DESC2: A self-leveling floor is a special dry mix that, when mixed with water, forms a liquid solution. This solution spreads evenly over the surface due to its own weight and creates a perfectly flat and smooth layer, filling all irregularities, holes, and cracks. It can be based on cement or gypsum.
FLOORING.DESC3: Perfectly level surface: This is its main advantage. Unlike other screeds, it provides a flawless base for any type of flooring. Thickness variety: It is possible to apply both thin (a few millimeters) and thick (several centimeters) layers, depending on the unevenness of the existing surface. Fast drying: Depending on the material type, a self-leveling floor dries relatively quickly, accelerating the renovation process. In some cases, it can be walked on within 1.5‚Äì3 hours, and full curing takes about 24 hours. High durability: Once hardened, the floor becomes resistant to mechanical and abrasive effects. Hygiene: It prevents the spread of bacteria and microorganisms and is easy to maintain. Compatibility with underfloor heating: Many types of self-leveling mixtures are compatible with underfloor heating systems.
FLOORING.DESC4: Proper installation of a self-leveling floor requires attention to detail and patience. If you lack experience in this field, it is better to contact professionals to ensure a high-quality and long-lasting result.

BETON_CONTACT.TITLE: Primer 'BETON-CONTACT'
BETON_CONTACT.DESCRIPTION: For dense, smooth surfaces before applying plaster. Suitable for concrete and oil-painted surfaces.

SPEC.TITLE: Special Primer 'Interior'
SPEC.DESCRIPTION: One of the most affordable primers by Starateli. Used indoors before painting or wallpapering...

UNIVERSAL.TITLE: Primer 'Universal'
UNIVERSAL.DESCRIPTION: Used indoors and outdoors for walls, ceilings, and floors. Strengthens applied materials...

DEEP.TITLE: Primer 'Deep Penetrating'
DEEP.DESCRIPTION: Used indoors and outdoors for old, fragile surfaces. Strengthens adhesion...

THIN.TITLE: Self-leveling 'Thin'
THIN.DESCRIPTION: Used for final smoothing of floor surfaces (concrete, cement-sand...) before laying...

THICK.TITLE: Self-leveling 'Thick'
THICK.DESCRIPTION: Used for final smoothing of concrete or cement-sand bases before floor covering...

HIGH.TITLE: Self-leveling 'Heavy Duty'
HIGH.DESCRIPTION: Ideal for surfaces requiring high operational loads such as garages or warehouses...

PRACTICAL.TITLE: Self-leveling 'Practical'
PRACTICAL.DESCRIPTION: Used for leveling before tile, laminate, parquet, linoleum installation...

FAST.TITLE: Self-leveling 'Fast-setting'
FAST.DESCRIPTION: Suitable for use in short-time projects and underfloor heating systems...

SONORA.TITLE: Polymer Waterproofing "SONORA"
SONORA.DESCRIPTION: Designed to create a solid, seamless waterproof coating on walls and floors inside buildings that are periodically exposed to moisture (wet rooms, showers, kitchens, laundries, etc.) before subsequent finishing work. Not intended for direct contact with drinking water or food products.

AQUASHIELD.TITLE: Brush-on Waterproofing "AQUASHIELD"
AQUASHIELD.DESCRIPTION: Intended for waterproofing facades, basements, foundations, swimming pools, and open water reservoirs; unheated spaces (basements, garages, balconies, etc.), as well as rooms periodically exposed to moisture (wet rooms, showers, kitchens, laundries, etc.). Suitable for both exterior and interior work, including underfloor heating systems. Applied on durable, non-deformable surfaces: concrete, cellular concrete, brick, cement plaster, screed, old tile coverings.

FACADE.TITLE: Facade Putty (Cement Base)
FACADE.DESCRIPTION: Used for final smoothing of floor surfaces (concrete, cement-sand, gypsum, anhydrite)...
